html: The SCDOT Call Center will close tonight (Oct. 2) at 8 pm and go to extended hours (6 am-8 pm) as of Wednesday, Oct. 3. The SCDOT Call Center operated 24 hours a day since the beginning of Hurricane Florence to assist motorists. 855-GO-SCDOT (855-467-2368).
text:
The SCDOT Call Center will close tonight (Oct. 2) at 8 pm and go to extended hours (6 am-8 pm) as of Wednesday, Oct. 3.

The SCDOT Call Center operated 24 hours a day since the beginning of Hurricane Florence to assist motorists. 

855-GO-SCDOT (855-467-2368).

text:

html: Due to the emergency flood situation in Georgetown, SCDOT will begin assembling a barrier wall on the US 17 bridge crossing the Waccamaw River at noon Sunday. US 17 will be restricted to one lane in each direction. Expect congestion and delays. Avoid travel if possible...
text:
Due to the emergency flood situation in Georgetown, SCDOT will begin assembling a barrier wall on the US 17 bridge crossing the Waccamaw River at noon Sunday.
US 17 will be restricted to one lane in each direction. 
Expect congestion and delays. Avoid travel if possible...

html: At 5am, Florence is over eastern SC, and should continue to weaken as it moves farther inland today. It should become a tropical depression tonight. Life-threatening, catastrophic flash floods and prolonged significant river flooding remain likely over portions of the Carolinas.pic.twitter.com/0cspfDeTyg

html: More than 165,000 households are without power across SC due to #Florence. If you lose power try to use flashlights instead of candles. Never use a generator inside your home or garage. Keep it more than 20 feet away from your home, doors, and windows for safety. #scwx #sctweets
text: More than 165,000 households are without power across SC due to #Florence. If you lose power try to use flashlights instead of candles. Never use a generator inside your home or garage. Keep it more than 20 feet away from your home, doors, and windows for safety. #scwx #sctweets

html: STAY FIRE SAFE When the lights go out, remember these tips: Use flashlights, not candles. Operate grills away from your home. Only use a generator if your home is designed for it. When using a generator, be careful where you store your fuel. #HurricaneFlorence #StaySafehttps://twitter.com/HorryEMD/status/1040669444383694848 …
text:
STAY FIRE SAFE
When the lights go out, remember these tips:

Use flashlights, not candles. 

Operate grills away from your home. 

Only use a generator if your home is designed for it.

When using a generator, be careful where you store your fuel. 

#HurricaneFlorence #StaySafehttps://twitter.com/HorryEMD/status/1040669444383694848 …

html: There’s good news, bad news and then the ugly. The good news is that #HurricaneFlorence has gone from a category 2 to a category 1, the bad news is that hurricanes are not wind events only. This is still a dangerous storm, take caution.pic.twitter.com/B9Fo95hKQg

html: Attention Horry County: Conditions have become too dangerous for public safety crews to respond. Responses will be slow or limited. text:
Attention Horry County: 
Conditions have become too dangerous for public safety crews to respond. Responses will be slow or limited. You may still call 911 and operators will provide verbal assistance until we can reach you. Please only call 911 for emergencies.#HurricaneFlorencepic.twitter.com/1UQGD6emLX

html: #OnThisDay in 1963, Dr. King marched on Washington to deliver his “I Have a Dream” speech. Due to the brave efforts of him and so many other civil rights leaders, I am now living my mother’s American Dream. I’m grateful to serve the American people in the footsteps of giants.

html: #IIOA sowing seeds of hope across America. “Opportunity Zones will give struggling areas a needed financial boost to sow seeds of prosperity and restore vitality to their neighborhoods by filling in their missing pieces of the puzzle.” @ChuckGrassleyhttps://medium.com/@ChuckGrassley/q-a-opportunity-zones-3881726475e2 …
text:
#IIOA sowing seeds of hope across America. 
“Opportunity Zones will give struggling areas a needed financial boost to sow seeds of prosperity and restore vitality to their neighborhoods by filling in their missing pieces of the puzzle.” @ChuckGrassleyhttps://medium.com/@ChuckGrassley/q-a-opportunity-zones-3881726475e2 …

html: Opportunity Zones can be the difference between an America where too many get left behind and one where the benefits of our prosperity can truly be shared by all. #IIOAhttps://www.washingtonexaminer.com/opinion/opportunity-sprouts-in-impoverished-areas-thanks-to-tax-reform …

html: More great news made possible by the #TaxCutsandJobsAct. This month, @PhilBryantMS nominated & @USTreasury certified 100 Mississippi communities as #IIOA opportunity zones. These areas are now eligible for incentives to encourage investment in distressed communities. #MSWorks
